courses.description:
Hello! and welcome to our introductory course on special operations in commercial aviation.  In this course we cover several important operations in aviation that require specific authorization from civil aviation authorities.
By taking this course, you will learn the following topics:
- Instrument Landing system (ILS) CAT II/II approaches
- Extended-range Twin-engine Operational Performance Standards (ETOPS)
- Reduced Vertical Separation Minimum
- Performance based navigation (PB)
- Controller-Pilot Data link communications (CPDLC)
- Automatic Depenent Surveillance Broadast (ADSB)
Who we are
We are Southern Engineering and Aviation Services, or SOENAS, for short. We are an aviation consulting company based in Cordoba, Argentina, founded in 2013 by our Director Federico Suarez. Federico has more than 20 years of experience working in commercial aircraft maintenance, both as an employee for several important Latin American Airlines and as a freelance consultant.
SOENAS brings together a team of industry experts from the commercial aircraft maintenance industry, and offers tailored management solutions, from supervising heavy maintenance checks for commercial airlines to managing Aircraft lease transitions for Aircraft leasing companies.
Over the years our team noticed there are certain subjects we need to teach employees whenever bringing on now people to our team of consultants, even when they're professionals with a background in aviation. This problem is repeated across the industry.
Commercial aviation is both highly standardized and regulated at a global level, and the extensive amount of documentation, procedures and agreements that are necessary to guarantee safety in aviation can sometimes seem daunting. Maintenance of commercial aircraft is no exception, and our courses aim to help you understand the most important aspects of this complex and unique environment.
Our team was worked to translate many years of our experience in the field into comprehensive courses that are easy to take in yet highly informative, no matter your background. You can expect:
- High quality, engaging class animation
- Pre-scripted content
- Clear, simple explanations that are easy to understand
- Knowledge assessments after every lecture
- Real life examples of documents and certificates you may encounter in the field.
target_audience: Professionals starting a career in aviation
Professionals from a non-technical backgroud working in an aviation environment

courses.description:
The Digital Manufacturing and Industrial Design Technology course is a forward-looking, industry-focused program that explores how digital technologies are reshaping the way products are designed, developed, and manufactured. This course is ideal for engineers, designers, product developers, and manufacturing professionals who want to gain practical knowledge of digital tools and smart manufacturing processes. By combining industrial design principles with digital manufacturing techniques, the course provides a holistic view of how innovation happens in the modern product lifecycle.
You will dive into the key pillars of digital manufacturing, including computer-aided design (CAD), computer-aided manufacturing (CAM), additive manufacturing (3D printing), CNC machining, digital twins, and Industry 4.0 technologies such as IoT, AI, and cloud-based production management. On the industrial design side, the course covers design thinking, ergonomics, aesthetics, user-centered design, and rapid prototyping. Together, these areas equip you to design with both functionality and manufacturability in mind.
Through hands-on projects, and real-world case studies, you'll learn how to bridge the gap between creative product design and efficient digital production. You'll also explore the role of sustainability and materials selection, data-driven design, and agile development methods in creating smarter, more adaptable manufacturing workflows. Whether you're working with physical products, smart devices, or connected systems, this course emphasizes how digital technologies reduce time-to-market, minimize waste, and enhance innovation.
By the end of the course, you will be equipped with a versatile skill set to lead or contribute to digital transformation initiatives in product design and manufacturing. You’ll gain practical experience using the tools and techniques that top companies rely on to stay competitive in a rapidly evolving global market. Whether you're looking to upskill, reskill, or take your career in a new direction, this course will prepare you for the future of intelligent product development and advanced manufacturing.
target_audience: Manufacturing personnel
Engineers
Managers & supervisors
Developers & programmers
Students

courses.title: CMRP 2025: Certification Exam Preparation Simulator(English)
courses.bio: Prepare for CMRP (Certified Maintenance and Reliability Professional) certification with the best SMRP material.
courses.description:
SMRP's CMRP certification is one of the most prestigious internationally for professionals dedicated to maintenance and reliability. This certification is based on 5 pillars contained in the SMRP Book of Knowledge in a 110-question exam with a time of 2.5 hours (150 minutes) closed book, usually administered at one of the Pearson Vue centers around the world.


Although there are preparation courses, I concluded that they were very expensive and that the average course time was not enough to address all the content satisfactorily. For this reason, I decided to prepare myself for this certification. To do this, I studied the material suggested by SMRP Book of Knowledge, I looked for videos, books and standard questions that would allow me to have a clearer vision of the focus of the exam.


I decided that once I obtained certification, I would dedicate myself to condensing the useful material into a test simulator, with questions similar to the real exam.


In this way, the "course" has 2 diagnostic tests of 10 questions and 1 simulation exam (110 questions) very similar to the real certification. In all cases, the questions have their respective explanation, and I recommend that it be reviewed and also seen as a study tool and not just a test.


I hope the simulator helps you achieve your goals, a warm hug!
target_audience: Maintenance professionals, maintenance specialists, reliability engineers, maintenance technicians and consultants seeking certification.

courses.title: Barriers in the Process Industry - Master Bowtie Analysis.
courses.bio: Your guidance to understand barriers and master Bowtie Barrier Analysis.
objectives: Students will gain the knowledge to identify all types of process safety barriers in the process, petroleum, and chemical industries.
Students will gain the knowledge to easily generate bowtie diagrams.
Students will gain the knowledge to conduct a successful physical barrier assessments.
Students will learn how to assure barriers strength through physical barrier assessments
Students will understand the linkage between the process safety indicators and barriers

Examples of Events Where Barriers Failed: Example 3: Pump Seal in Offshore Module

requirements: Students should have a basic knowledge about the process industry , process equipment and operations.
courses.description:
The main objective of this course is to shed the light on the importance of barriers that could prevent and mitigate the impact of catastrophic process safety incidents such as fires, explosions, and toxic releases.
In this course, we will talk about barriers in the process industry and how to identify barriers based on the most recognized and generally acceptable recommended practices such the International Oil and Gas Producers (IOGP), Center for Chemical Process Safety (CCPS), and Energy Institute (EI).
We will also illustrate bow tie diagrams and we will describe ,in details, how to develop a bow tie diagram for any hazardous scenario from scratch using one of the best software in the market (Bow tie XP).
The common barrier models and the relationship between barriers effectiveness assurance and the process safety indicators will be covered during the course.
In this course, you will also be exposed to four examples for events where barriers failed and we will identify together those barriers.
Finally, process safety auditors and assessors whose role is to identify defects in any facility barriers will be given a practical approach for effective physical barrier assessment.
I hope you enjoy this compressed course and please do not hesitate to ask for any clarifications.
Accept my greetings,
Mohamed Mesbah
target_audience: Process safety engineers
Process safety auditors
Asset Integrity engineers
Operations engineers
Plant managers
HSE engineers
Area supervisors
Process engineers

courses.description:
This course comprehensively covers centrifugal pumps performance testing requirements and procedures according to the API standard 610 12th edition. The API standard 610 includes all requirements for the performance testing of centrifugal pumps given in "ISO 9906 - Rotodynamic pumps — Hydraulic performance acceptance tests — Grades 1, 2 and 3 " and "ANSI/HI 14.6 - Rotodynamic pumps, Hydraulic performance acceptance tests - Grade 1, 2 and 3". Over and above these requirements API standard 610 has several additional requirements. These additional requirements are discussed and explained in detail in this course.
Moreover, there are several special conditions that the customer and supplier can agree on, which than become the part of the performance testing protocol and these requirements override the stipulations of the standard. Such cases are also explained in this course.
Overall, the API standard 610 asks for tighter tolerances and stringent requirements for hydraulic performance testing of pumps. In addition to the hydraulic performance testing the customer can include the following optional tests as well:
1. Mechanical run test
2. NPSH required test
3. Complete unit test
4. Sound level test
5. Auxiliary equipment test
6. Bearing-housing resonance test
7. Spares parts test
An introduction to these optional tests is included in this course. However, detailed course on several of these tests are available separately as some of these test (like sound level tests) require complete understanding of the standards and procedures ab initio.
target_audience: Engineers, Managers and professionals in process industry, power plants, refineries and oil and gas sectors
Inspectors and quality assurance team members responsible for conducting hydraulic performance tests
Persons responsible for preparing pump specifications and acceptance criteria
Test bed engineers and managers

courses.bio: inhibit corrosion, control microbial activity (biocide), scavenge , scale inhibitor , oil Demulsifier
objectives: chemicals designed to inhibit corrosion, control microbial activity (biocide)
chemicals designed to Oxygen scavenge ,hydrogen sulfied scavenge , control scaling(scale inhibitor)and/or oil Demulsifierle inhibitor), an
The performance verification of chemical treatment programs
how to choose injection loation

Corrosion Inhibitor: Evaluation and Selection of Corrosion Inhibitors part1
Evaluation and Selection of Corrosion Inhibitors part2
Scale Inhibitor: Types of scale antiscalent and Injection location
Oil Demulsifier: Methods of emulsion Breaking or Demulsification part1
Methods of emulsion Breaking or Demulsification part2

requirements: No programming experience needed. you will learn everything you need to Know
courses.description:
• Chemical treatment involves the planned addition of a site-specific combination of chemicals. The treatment may include chemicals designed to inhibit corrosion, control microbial activity (biocide), Oxygen scavenge ,hydrogen sulfied scavenge , control scaling(scale inhibitor), and/or oil Demulsifier,The performance of chemical treatment programs must be verified. The two most common application methods used for chemical treatments are continuous injection and batch treatment.
• Corrosion inhibitors are substances that are added to a pipeline to reduce the corrosion rate).
• Biocides are used to mitigate various microbiological problems.
• Scavengers are used to react with a particular potentially corrosive species making it unavailable to participate in corrosion reactions. The two most commonly used scavengers in the oil and gas industry are oxygen and H2S scavengers.
• Scaling occurs when water constituents combine to form insoluble compounds which are then deposited on the pipe wall. Typical scales include calcium carbonate, calcium sulfate, and barium sulfate and scale inhibitor prevent this formation to occurs
• Dehydration chemicals, or demulsifiers, are chemical compounds that are widely used to destabilize, and assist in coalescence of, crude-oil emulsions.
• Treatment chemicals are injected continuously when a specified concentration of chemical is desired in the fluids being transported. Continuous injection requires the installation of chemical pumps and other equipment including a chemical holding tank, a control unit, control interface, and potentially a mixer and flow meter.
• Chemical injection can be performed through an open tube or quill or using an atomizing nozzle. Atomizing nozzles are used to disperse a chemical into the gas phase. Where top-of-line corrosion is occurring, it may be necessary to inject the treatment chemical into the gas phase. If chemicals are added directly to the line (i.e., not using a tube or quill), corrosion may occur at the site of chemical injection. The materials within the injection system should be compatible with the product (e.g., storage tanks, elastomers, tubing, etc.) The most effective position for chemical injection is the center of the pipe or vessel.
• Batch treatments are designed to lay down an inhibition film to provide protection between treatments. Chemicals are typically pumped into the pipeline at a high concentration (generally, tens of thousands of parts per million) for a brief period of time.
target_audience: oil and gas operator , engineers , beginner , student, technologist
mangers, Technicians, Chemical and petroleum industry specialists

courses.title: Basics of vibrations and vibration measurement (Cat 1)
courses.bio: Vibration fundamentals and analysis of vibration measurement with respect to rotating machines
objectives: The standards measurement units for machine vibration that is displacement, velocity and acceleration

An understanding of the vibration behavior of rotodynamic pumps

Vibration measurement transducers and their application

Principles of vibration: Degrees of freedom of a vibrating systems and modes of vibration
Shaft orbit plots - shaft vibration displacement
Impact of mass, damping and stiffness on the behavior of a system
Data Acquisition: Vibration measurement instruments and mounting of transducers
Equipment knowledge: Equipment knowledge - Pumps, fans and compressors
Equipment knowledge - Steam turbines, gas turbines and generators
Equipment knowledge - Pumps and piping resonance
Acceptance testing standards: Introduction to vibration testing and acceptance standards ISO7919, ISO10816...

requirements: Basic engineering knowledge
An understanding of rotary machines
Industry experience
courses.description:
One of the most important condition monitoring tool for the rotary machines is the vibration analysis. This is equally true for the pumps and pumping systems. The pumps exhibit signature vibration signals related to hydraulic turbulence, cavitation in addition to sub-synchronous vibrations, synchronous vibrations, and super-synchronous vibrations related to vane-pass frequencies, and other vibration exciting phenomenon. Many of these vibration frequencies are common for other rotary machines including compressors, turbines etc., and therefore are of a much larger interest in general industry.
This course “Basics of Vibrations and vibration measurement (Cat 1)” comprises of all topics included in Cat 1 vibration analyst course as recommended by ISO 18436-2.
This course has 5 sections namely - Vibration principles, Data acquisition, Signal processing, Equipment knowledge, and Acceptance testing. In these sections the basic motion of vibration and related terms and terminology, the vibration measurement instruments and transducers, the Time Waveform signals, the Frequency Response FFT spectrum and Shaft Orbit Analysis, the basic knowledge of rotary equipment used in the industry and finally an introduction to ISO vibration testing and acceptance standards for different types of machines are covered. These concepts provide a sound basis to understand the fundamental of vibrations. Therefore, this course is a precursor to the very detailed courses on vibrations on pumps and pumping systems, namely – “Vibration measurement and acceptance criteria as per API 610, 12th edition” and “Vibration measurement and acceptance criteria a per ISO 9906 and HI 9.6.4 standards” already available on this website.
For advanced understanding of vibration measurement and vibration analysis Cat II and Cat III vibration analyst programs are recommended.
target_audience: Engineers, managers and supervisors keen to understand the rotodynamic pumps behavior
Those responsible for condition monitoring and reliability program development
Professionals interested to understand the vibration behavior of pumps and pumping systems

courses.description:
The purpose of construction plans (drawings) is to present clear, concise and easily read information to those individuals involved on a building project, whether that be a simple house, or a skyscraper.
Construction plans (drawings) use a universal language to communicate ideas and information in a graphical format.
By following standard conventions, the amount of space on a construction plan to communicate the ideas and information is reduced.
The main focus of the course will be learning how to read a residential construction set of plans. We will look at how they are organised, what kind of plans need to be included, what is shown on plans, look at symbols & abbreviations, and finish off with an exercise.
We will be using plans from an Architectural firm here in New Zealand, which will also be applicable to my US & UK audiences due to the layouts & formats being internationally the same.
The course also covers the basics of scaling. As you can appreciate, construction projects are too large to be drawn to a 1:1 scale, thus, we need to use scales to reduce the size onto paper that is manageable for construction teams. We will take a look at both the imperial and metric architect’s scale due to countries using either, or, or even both unit systems, thus catering for all.
Included within the course are resources and exercises to reinforce your learning as you progress.
If you are new to the construction industry, or building your first home, and want to learn how to read plans, then this course is for you.
So that said, enrol now and learn how to read residential construction plans.

courses.description:
Business and technology news is being overwhelmed with stories about  5G. Some CEOs and analysts have called it the on-ramp to the 4th industrial revolution. You may be wondering -- what exactly is 5G and why is it getting so much attention? Or, you may want to know how you can use 5G technology to develop new products or services, make money, or improve the delivery of public services. You’ve come to the right course!
I’ve been in the telecommunications industry for over 30 years and have worked, in one capacity or another, for three of the largest US communications service providers. Much of that time has been spent in wireless networks. In my career, I have seen technology leap forward and evolve at a faster and faster pace but never with such vigor as 5G.
All that you hear about self-driving cars and self-driving trucks, autonomous drones, the Internet of Things, Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality --- they all need a fast, reliable, high-capacity wireless network. That’s the promise and the potential of 5G. In this course, Understanding 5G, we’ll take a look at what 5G is, how we got here, and what it means to you as a consumer, a business owner or entrepreneur, a property owner or building manager, and as a citizen.
Join me, and let’s get started in understanding 5G wireless communications.

Understanding the regulatory landscape for medical devices is essential for ensuring compliance with regulations and avoiding costly mistakes.

You can take on more complex roles within your organization and contribute to the development of innovative medical devices.

requirements: Anyone interested in the medical device industry, whether you are a student, recent graduate, or a professional in the field, can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course.
courses.description:
Overview
A Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course is a program of study that covers the regulation and compliance requirements for medical devices in various countries, including the United States, Europe, and other regions. The course is designed to provide students with an understanding of the regulatory requirements for the design, development, manufacturing, and marketing of medical devices.
The course typically covers a wide range of topics, including regulatory affairs, quality assurance, risk management, clinical trials, product registration, and post-market surveillance. Students learn about the different regulatory bodies that oversee medical devices, such as the FDA in the United States and the European Medicines Agency in Europe.
The course may also include practical training on how to prepare and submit regulatory documents, how to conduct a risk assessment, and how to develop a quality management system for medical devices. Graduates of the program may go on to work in various roles in the medical device industry, such as regulatory affairs specialists, quality assurance managers, or clinical research associates.
Benefits of Learning
There are several benefits to learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course, including:
Increased job opportunities: With the growing demand for medical devices, the medical device industry needs professionals with expertise in regulatory affairs to ensure that devices comply with regulations and are safe for patients. Learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course can provide you with the necessary skills and knowledge to pursue a career in this field.
Better understanding of regulations: Understanding the regulatory landscape for medical devices is essential for ensuring compliance with regulations and avoiding costly mistakes. Learning about regulatory affairs can provide you with a comprehensive understanding of the regulatory requirements for medical devices, which can help you navigate the regulatory process more effectively.
Improved quality management: Regulatory compliance is closely tied to quality management in the medical device industry. By learning about regulatory affairs, you can develop a better understanding of how to implement and maintain a quality management system for medical devices.
Enhanced patient safety: Medical devices are designed to improve patient outcomes, and regulatory compliance is essential for ensuring that devices are safe and effective. By learning about regulatory affairs, you can play a critical role in ensuring patient safety by helping to develop and maintain compliant medical devices.
Advancement in your career: A Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course can provide you with a competitive advantage in the job market and can help you advance in your career. By developing a deeper understanding of regulatory affairs, you can take on more complex roles within your organization and contribute to the development of innovative medical devices.
Who can Learn
A Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course can be beneficial for a wide range of individuals who are interested in pursuing a career in the medical device industry or are already working in the field. Some of the individuals who can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course include:
Recent graduates: Graduates with a degree in engineering, science, or other related fields can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course as it can provide them with the necessary knowledge and skills to pursue a career in the medical device industry.
Medical device professionals: Medical device professionals who are already working in the industry can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course to enhance their knowledge and skills in regulatory affairs and quality management.
Regulatory affairs professionals: Professionals who are already working in regulatory affairs can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course to expand their knowledge and stay up-to-date with the latest regulations and requirements.
Quality assurance professionals: Quality assurance professionals can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course to develop a better understanding of regulatory compliance and how it relates to quality management.
Healthcare professionals: Healthcare professionals who are interested in the development and use of medical devices can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course to gain a better understanding of the regulatory requirements and safety considerations related to medical devices.
In summary, anyone interested in the medical device industry, whether you are a student, recent graduate, or a professional in the field, can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course.
Career Scope
There is a wide range of career opportunities available for individuals who have completed a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course. Some of the career paths that graduates can pursue include:
Regulatory Affairs Specialist: Regulatory Affairs Specialists are responsible for ensuring that medical devices comply with regulations and standards. They prepare and submit regulatory documents to the relevant regulatory agencies, develop strategies for regulatory compliance, and provide guidance on regulatory requirements.
Quality Assurance Manager: Quality Assurance Managers are responsible for ensuring that medical devices meet quality standards and comply with regulations. They develop and maintain quality management systems, conduct audits, and oversee the implementation of corrective and preventive actions.
Clinical Research Associate: Clinical Research Associates are responsible for managing clinical trials for medical devices. They work closely with regulatory agencies, study sponsors, and healthcare professionals to ensure that clinical trials are conducted in compliance with regulations and ethical standards.
Medical Device Consultant: Medical Device Consultants provide expert advice on regulatory compliance, quality management, and clinical trials for medical devices. They work with medical device companies, healthcare providers, and regulatory agencies to develop and implement strategies for regulatory compliance.
Product Manager: Product Managers are responsible for overseeing the development and marketing of medical devices. They work closely with cross-functional teams, including regulatory affairs, quality assurance, and clinical research, to ensure that medical devices meet customer needs and regulatory requirements.
In summary, completing a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course can lead to a variety of career opportunities in the medical device industry, including regulatory affairs, quality assurance, clinical research, consulting, and product management.
Salary Package with Job Role In India and Foreign
The salary package for individuals working in Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs roles varies depending on factors such as job role, experience, location, and company size.
In India, the average salary for regulatory affairs professionals ranges from INR 4-10 lakhs per annum. Quality assurance managers can earn between INR 5-12 lakhs per annum, and clinical research associates can earn between INR 3-7 lakhs per annum. Product managers in the medical device industry can earn between INR 8-20 lakhs per annum.
In foreign countries, the salary package is generally higher. The average salary for regulatory affairs professionals in the United States ranges from $50,000 to $150,000 per annum, depending on experience and location. Quality assurance managers in the United States can earn between $60,000 to $150,000 per annum, while clinical research associates can earn between $50,000 to $100,000 per annum. Product managers in the medical device industry in the United States can earn between $80,000 to $200,000 per annum.
It is important to note that the salary package can vary greatly depending on the specific job role and the company size, among other factors. Additionally, salaries are often higher in cities with a higher cost of living.
Requirements To Study
The requirements to study a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course may vary depending on the institution offering the course. However, some general requirements that are typically expected include:
Educational Qualifications: Students interested in pursuing a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course are expected to have a bachelor's degree in science, engineering, or a related field. Some institutions may require a minimum GPA or a specific set of prerequisite courses.
Work Experience: While not always required, some institutions may prefer students with some prior work experience in the medical device industry or related field.
Language Proficiency: Some institutions may require students to demonstrate proficiency in English or other languages, especially for courses that are taught in English.
Letters of Recommendation: Many institutions require applicants to provide letters of recommendation from professors, employers, or other professionals who can attest to their academic or professional abilities.
Standardized Tests: Some institutions may require applicants to take standardized tests such as the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) or the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT).
It is essential to check the specific requirements of the institution offering the course before applying. Additionally, some courses may require additional qualifications or certifications, such as a certification from the Regulatory Affairs Professionals Society (RAPS), depending on the specific focus of the course.
Key Features
The key features of a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course can vary depending on the institution offering the course. However, some common key features of such a course include:
Comprehensive Curriculum: A Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course typically covers a broad range of topics related to the development, regulation, and marketing of medical devices. These topics may include regulatory compliance, quality assurance, clinical trials, product management, and risk management.
Experienced Faculty: The course is typically taught by experienced faculty members who have extensive knowledge and expertise in the medical device industry and regulatory affairs.
Industry-Relevant Assignments and Projects: Students may be assigned projects or case studies that are directly relevant to the medical device industry, allowing them to apply their theoretical knowledge to practical scenarios.
Hands-On Training: Some institutions may offer hands-on training opportunities, such as internships or industry placements, which can provide students with practical experience in the medical device industry.
Industry Interaction: Some institutions may invite industry experts to give guest lectures or organize industry visits, which can provide students with insights into the latest trends and developments in the medical device industry.
Certification: Upon completion of the course, some institutions may offer a certificate or a diploma in Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs, which can demonstrate the student's knowledge and expertise in the field.
In summary, a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course typically offers a comprehensive curriculum, experienced faculty, industry-relevant assignments and projects, hands-on training, industry interaction, and certification upon completion.
target_audience: Anyone interested in the medical device industry, whether you are a student, recent graduate, or a professional in the field, can benefit from learning a Medical Devices and Regulatory Affairs course.

courses.description:
Safety & Pressure Relief Valves Masterclass: Sizing, Selection, Installation & Best Practices
The Essential Guide to Relief and Safety Valves—Design, Sizing, Standards & Real-World Application
Properly functioning safety and pressure relief valves are the last line of defense against catastrophic equipment failure in process plants and industrial facilities. This comprehensive course equips you with the knowledge, tools, and confidence to ensure your relief valves provide maximum protection—safeguarding both people and assets.
Why Take This Course?
Critical Safety Skills:
Inadequate selection or sizing of relief valves can lead to major incidents. This course provides a deep, practical understanding of every aspect of safety and pressure relief valves.
Industry Standards & Best Practices:
Learn how to apply the latest ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code (Section VIII) and API RP520 recommendations in your work.
Real-World Engineering Focus:
Benefit from field observations, practical examples, and lessons learned from years of hands-on experience.
What You’ll Learn
Valve Construction & Operation:
Understand the internal components, operation principles, and function of safety and pressure relief valves
How relief valves respond to system conditions and why proper performance is vital
Sizing, Selection & Application:
Step-by-step pressure relief valve sizing with formulae and capacity correction factors
How to select the right valve for your process, including reference data and technical recommendations
Application of ASME and API standards for sizing, selection, and installation
Typical sizing examples to reinforce learning
Installation, Testing & Maintenance:
Best practices for assembly, installation, and testing to ensure optimum performance and safety
Common installation mistakes—and how to avoid them
Piping considerations that impact valve performance
Practical Tools & Resources:
Easy-to-use technical data, charts, and reference materials
Section quizzes to reinforce key concepts and test your knowledge
Who Should Enroll?
Process, mechanical, and safety engineers
Piping designers and plant operators
Maintenance and reliability professionals
Engineering students and recent graduates
Anyone responsible for equipment safety and compliance in process industries
Course Features
High-quality video lectures with detailed graphics and real-world examples
Step-by-step sizing and selection methodology
Downloadable reference materials and technical data
Section quizzes for continuous assessment
Lifetime access: Study at your own pace
Instructor support via Udemy Q&A
By the End of This Course, You Will:
Confidently size, select, and specify safety and pressure relief valves for any industrial application
Apply ASME & API standards and best practices in your daily work
Recognize and avoid common installation and operational mistakes
Ensure your valves deliver maximum protection for your plant, people, and the surrounding community
Contribute to a culture of safety and reliability in your facility
Get Started Today!
Preview the free course videos and curriculum. Join engineers and professionals worldwide who trust WR Training for clear, practical safety and engineering education.
Click “Enroll Now” and become a safety and pressure relief valve expert!
WR Training – Your Partner in Industrial Safety and Reliability
Spread the wings of your knowledge


IMPORTANT SAFETY NOTES


It is important to always remember that a pressure relief valve is a safety device employed to protect pressure vessels or systems from catastrophic failure. With this in mind, the application of pressure relief valves should be assigned only to fully trained personnel and be in strict compliance with rules provided by the governing Codes and Standards


Pressure relief valves must be sized, selected and installed by those who have complete knowledge of:
The pressure relieving requirements of the system to be protected
The environmental conditions particular to that installation


Pressure relief valves sizing and selection is the responsibility of:
The process engineer
The user of the system to be protected


Sizing and selection of pressure relief valves should not be based on arbitrarily assumed conditions or incomplete information. Merely having a mandatory safety valve installation does not make a system safe

When you think you’ve got a good grasp on a topic within the course, you can test your knowledge by taking the quiz. If you pass, wonderful ! If not, you can review the videos and notes again or ask us for help in the Q&A section.

courses.description:
A standard operating procedure is a set of step-by-step instructions for performing a routine activity. Standard operating procedure should be followed the same way every time to guarantee that the organization remains consistent and in compliance with industry regulations and business standards. SOPs provide the policies, processes and standards needed for an organization to succeed. They reduce errors increase efficiency and enhance profitability. They also create a safe work environment and produce guidelines for how to resolve issues and overcome obstacles. An effective standard operating procedure explains the steps taken to complete a task and informs the employee of any risk associated with the process. The instructions should be brief and easy to understand with a focus on how things should be done rather than what needs to be done. Before writing an SOP, the author should perform a risk assessment of all the steps in the procedure.
The assessment should identify any obstacles that might arise during the process and any risk associated with the obstacles. To decide which procedure would benefit from an OSP organizations should make a list of all their business processes. Managers should discuss employees day-to-day responsibilities and tasks to ensure all procedures are accounted for. Any routine task that multiple employees handle should be considered for SOP creation.
target_audience: CEO, managers, supervisors, directors, consultants, companies, manufacturers, governments, hospitals, students, general public etc.

courses.description:
Instrumentation rests at the intersection of many disciplines, skills and trades, including: automation, process and mechanical engineering, programming, electronics, etc. Few people can claim to be experts in all these fields, yet many must use measuring instruments and the data they provide to fulfill their duties and achieve their objectives. One cannot improve something one cannot measure and all measurements are imperfect.


This course provides a comprehensive overview of the instruments used in continuous industrial processes of gases, liquids and granular solids, such as the ones from used in the water treatment, oil&gas, chemical, mining, food and thermal power generation industries.


It describes and compares the instruments measuring the important properties that are:
Temperature
Pressure
Level
Vibrations
Flow
Composition
This reviews over 80 of the most frequently encountered device types, such as thermocouples, RTDs, Bourdon and diaphragm pressure gauges, hydrostatic and ultrasonic level indicators, orifice plate flow meters, NDIR analyzers, and much, much more.


As to ease the comprehension, as well as to provide context and tools to allow everyone to build a mastery of these technologies, this courses reviews:
The properties measured and their common units
The error types in the data
The data transmission approaches
How instruments connect themselves to the process
Process and instruments drawings
The criterion for instrument selection

courses.description:
ASE Safety Academy has prepared a dedicated e-learning course titled:
Electrical and Non-Electrical Equipment in Hazardous Areas – Basic Knowledge
This training covers the types of protection used for electrical and mechanical equipment designed for use in explosive atmospheres. We will explain the meaning of each part of the explosion protection marking found on the nameplate of equipment intended for hazardous areas, along with detailed discussions of individual types of protection.
The course curriculum includes, among others, the following topics:
Nameplate marking
Explosion protection marking (Ex marking)
Hazardous area zones and equipment categories
Types of protection for electrical equipment (in accordance with IEC 60079)
Types of protection for non-electrical equipment (in accordance with ISO 80079)
Explosion groups (Gas and Dust Groups)
Temperature classes (T-class)
Equipment Protection Levels (EPL)
The training concludes with a final exam, which can be retaken multiple times. A certificate is awarded upon passing with a minimum score of 70%.
Upon completing the course, the participant will:
Have a solid understanding of the basic types of protection used in explosion-proof equipment;
Be able to read and interpret the Ex marking of both electrical and non-electrical equipment used in hazardous areas;
Understand, at a basic level, how to select equipment appropriate to a given hazardous area zone.

requirements: Desire to learn more about waste management

courses.description:
Waste management or waste disposal includes the processes and actions required to manage waste from its inception to its final disposal. This includes the collection, transport, treatment, and disposal of waste, together with monitoring and regulation of the waste management processes and waste-related laws, technologies and economics mechanisms. Waste can be solid, liquid, or gases and each type has different methods of disposal and management. Waste management deals with types of waste including industrial, biological, household, municipal, organic, biomedical, radioactive wastes. proper management of waste is important for building sustainable and liveable cities but it remains a challenge for many developing countries and cities. Waste collection methods vary widely among different countries and regions. Domestic waste collection services are often provided by local government authorities, or by private companies for industrial waste. Some areas, especially those in less developed countries, do not have formal waste collection system.
The segregation of waste is very important: this is the separation of wet and dry waste. The purpose is to recycle dry waste easily and to use wet waste as  compost. When segregating waste, the amount of waste that gets landfilled reduces considerably, resulting in lower levels of air and water pollution. Importantly waste segregation should be based on the type of waste and the most appropriate treatment and disposal. There are multiple facets of waste management that all come with hazards, both for those around the disposal site and those who work within waste management.
target_audience: Waste management professionals, environmental agencies, waste collectors, governments, hospitals, businesses , municipal agencies, managers, directors students, general public etc.

objectives: ISO/IEC 27001 - Information Security Management Systems controls
ISO/IEC 27001 - Information Security Management Systems requirements

Fundamental Aspects of getting your organisation ISO/IEC 27001 certified
How to do information security controls audits
How to do information security controls consulting

Conclusion: Thank you and best of luck

requirements: No, The session has been recorded by a paragon from the IT controls audit team in easy speaking language.
courses.description:
At the end of the course you will be able to
1. Design and implement an ISMS complying with all the mandatory elements specified in the main body of ISO/IEC 27001,
2. Identify and assess the information security risks facing those parts of the organization that are declared in scope for your ISMS,
3. Systematically check and record the status of your security risks and controls,
4.Once your ISMS is operating normally, the metrics are looking good and you have amassed sufficient evidence , it can be formally audited for compliance with '27001 by an accredited certification body.
Where does ISO 27001 fit in?
ISO 27001 is the international standard that provides the specification for a best-practice ISMS and covers the compliance requirements.
While ISO 27001 offers the specification, ISO 27002 provides the code of conduct – guidance and recommended best practices that can be used to enforce the specification.


Benefits of an ISMS
An ISO 27001-compliant ISMS does more than simply help you comply with laws and win business. It a can also:
Respond to evolving security threats: Constantly adapting to changes both in the environment and inside the organisation, an ISMS reduces the threat of continually evolving risks.
Improve company culture: An ISMS’s holistic approach covers the whole organisation, not just IT. This enables employees to readily understand risks and embrace security controls as part of their everyday working practices.
Secure your information in all its forms: An ISMS helps protect all forms of information, whether digital, paper-based or in the Cloud.
Increase your attack resilience: Implementing and maintaining an ISMS will significantly increase your organisation’s resilience to cyber attacks.
Manage all your information in one place: An ISMS provides a central framework for keeping your organisation’s information safe and managing it all in one place.
Reduce costs associated with information security: Thanks to the risk assessment and analysis approach of an ISMS, organisations can reduce costs spent on indiscriminately adding layers of defensive technology that might not work.
Protect the confidentiality, availability and integrity of your data: An ISMS offers a set of policies, procedures, technical and physical controls to protect the confidentiality, availability and integrity of your information.
target_audience: Information Security lead auditor, Information security managers, Information security consultants and auditors, Information security officers, Information security risk specialists Managers and business owners People involved in the implementation and administration of information security management systems according to ISO/IEC 27001

courses.description:
This course is intended to provide students with a comprehensive overview of the drug regulatory affairs field. The regulatory environment for drug development and approval is complex and highly regulated, and it is essential for those working in the pharmaceutical industry to understand the key principles and requirements.
Throughout the course, students will learn about the regulatory framework for drug development, including the various phases of the drug development process, from preclinical studies to clinical trials, and the importance of good clinical practice. They will also gain a thorough understanding of regulatory submissions, including the new drug application (NDA) and abbreviated new drug application (ANDA), as well as the importance of regulatory strategies for pharmaceutical products.
In addition to regulatory submissions, the course will cover post-approval requirements and lifecycle management, including quality assurance and good manufacturing practices (GMP), pharmacovigilance and drug safety, and compliance and inspections in drug regulatory affairs. Students will also learn about the various regulatory agencies involved in drug approval, such as the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and the guidelines and regulations they follow.
Finally, the course will explore global regulatory affairs and harmonization and the future trends and challenges in drug regulatory affairs. By the end of the course, students will have gained a comprehensive understanding of the drug regulatory affairs field and will be well-equipped to navigate the complex regulatory environment of drug development and approval.
target_audience: This course is intended for a wide range of learners interested in the drug regulatory affairs field. Professionals in the pharmaceutical industry, including regulatory affairs professionals, quality assurance professionals, clinical research associates, and drug safety specialists, will find the course content valuable in gaining a comprehensive understanding of the regulatory environment for drug development and approval. In addition to industry professionals, students studying pharmaceutical sciences, clinical research, pharmacology, or related fields will find the course content beneficial in understanding the regulatory requirements and guidelines that govern drug development and approval. The course will also be useful for those seeking a career in regulatory affairs and wish to learn more about the field. Finally, anyone with an interest in the pharmaceutical industry and the regulatory environment governing drug development and approval will find this course informative and valuable. This includes patients, patient advocates, and caregivers who want to learn more about the drug development process and the regulatory safeguards in place to ensure drug safety and efficacy. Overall, this course is designed to be accessible to learners with diverse backgrounds and experience levels. Learners who complete this course will gain a thorough understanding of the drug regulatory affairs field, and be well-equipped to navigate the complex regulatory environment of drug development and approval.

courses.title: Oil and Gas Drilling Guide
courses.bio: How to drill an oil and gas well
objectives: Oil and Gas Drilling Guide
requirements: None
courses.description:
If you want to learn about oil drilling as a beginner, then check out this book!
How to drill an oil and gas well from A to Z, or in a shorter form from 1 to 7.
The first step, is to determine what type of rock we will be drilling. The second step is to refine this preliminary well configuration by determining the exact dimensions required of casing strings. Afterwards, the third stage is to select the appropriate bits, bottom hole assembly (BHA) and drillstring for each hole section.
The fourth step is a big one, selecting a rig, which goes hand in hand with the abovementioned characteristics of drilling a well. Eventually, we get a shortlist and go to the market to close the best fit for purpose rig contract. The fifth step is the huge logistics framework that surrounds a drilling operation to ensure it goes smoothly and most important of all, for safety to prevail. The sixth step, is to plug and abandon the well, gladly, strict regulations have been put in place to ensure industry best practices are always followed.
Last but not least, the seventh step encompasses all of the previous six, which is to assess and mitigate the environmental impact of all the operations. Safety is, from the beginning until the end of oil and gas drilling, the n.1 priority.
About the Expert
I am a Mechanical & Petroleum Engineer (dual masters) with five years of work experience, always representing the same O&G company and doing so in four different countries: Portugal, Namibia, Morocco and Brazil. I am fluent in four languages: Portuguese, English, Spanish and French.
The international experience during my childhood where I lived in Italy, Brazil and Argentina (other than Portugal) aided me in thinking out of the box. The two exchange programs I participated in Sweden and Argentina reinforced this situation and helped me understand that an international environment incorporated with strong teamwork is definitely the key to success.
Travelling is one of my big passions, I have travelled a lot during my childhood and I have travelled a lot for my job. Luckily, I also have a competition with my wife, which is to visit all the countries in the world, we are passed the sixty countries and we want to reach the seventy countries mark ASAP!
target_audience: People Interested In Oil and Gas Drilling

courses.description:
Embark on a course that introduces you to the essentials of international food law, laying a strong foundation for understanding this important field. Tailored for those seeking a solid foundation in this vital field, the curriculum effortlessly navigates the challenges inherent in food law through the examination of real-world examples and case studies.
Commencing with a fundamental exploration of the essence of food, the course progressively unfolds, delving into the inner workings of international agencies and agreements. Notably, it sheds light on key agencies such as the World Trade Organization (WTO) and illustrates the complexities of dispute resolution mechanisms, offering participants a nuanced understanding of the regulatory frameworks governing global food trade.
A pivotal focus of the course is devoted to the critical theme of food safety, recognizing it as a cornerstone in the landscape of international food law. By delving into the regulations and impact of the Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI) on trade, participants gain valuable insights into the central role that safety standards play in shaping the dynamics of international food trade.
This educational journey serves as a comprehensive exploration of the multifaceted layers within the realm of international food law, equipping participants with knowledge and analytical skills essential for navigating this intricate terrain. Whether you are a legal professional, industry expert, or policy enthusiast, this course provides a compelling opportunity to deepen your comprehension of international food law—a critical aspect in shaping the future landscape of global food systems.
The course stands out as a valuable resource for professionals seeking to enhance their expertise or enthusiasts eager to gain insights into the regulatory frameworks governing the global food industry. Through a user-friendly approach and practical examples, participants can expect to emerge well-versed in the complexities of international food law, ready to make informed decisions in their respective fields.

In this course, I personally train you to use my proprietary Empowerment Coaching Model to help professionals set new goals and achieve outstanding results.

With over 20+ hours of video tutorials, 335+ downloadable resources ready to use, hands-on practice assignments, interactive learning and Q & A, this continually updated course keeps you relevant and indispensable. Let's break it down for you:

NEXT 7 SECTIONS: We get interactive again as you watch 7 Professional client case-studies. These sections will test your people skills and guide you to understand the psychological chain reactions that stop Professionals from being their best. I give you the inside track on why this happens as well as give you the simple framework to use so that you can quickly spot these attributes in the clients you coach.


NEXT 9 SECTIONS: Now that you are familiar with the top Professionals and the issues that negatively impact them, now it is time to learn how you intervene during the Life Coach session. In the next 9 sections, you discover the exact life coaching techniques, why it is used and how to apply the technique during the life coaching session. You are given the step-by-step training so that you become proficient in using these techniques to support your Professional Client’s goals.


NEXT 4 SECTIONS: Now you are ready to connect with prospective clients, enroll them in your program and coach them! The next 4 sections of your Professional Empowerment Life Coach Certification Training focus on finding clients, the Discovery Session and the RESULTS coaching sessions. Mindset Life Coach Training Made Easy with Ready-To-Use Sessions
You don’t have to waste time trying to figure out what works and what doesn’t. The hard work, research and carefully crafted Mindset Life Coach Session guides give you the exact timings, coaching questions, activities, and resources. With 2 Levels of Certification included with your one-time course purchase, your skill and professionalism as a Master Trained Mindset Life Coach is world-class.


Mindset Life Coach Training Certification Course Reviews
Your success as a Mindset Life Coach is my purpose! If you have never met me before my name is Louise Anne Maurice. The thousands and thousands of people I have either coached, trained, consulted or taught over the past 30+ years have benefited from my Empowered Coaching Approach. I want you to benefit as well!
Here are just a few of the reviews people, just like you, have shared about their experience before, during and/or after learning in the Mindset Life Coach Training Course. You can also scroll past the Instructor Profiles to read more reviews.


“This course is a must-do for every life coach! Louise Anne Maurice highlights the deep truth of our "why's". Why we ruminate and talk negatively. More importantly, this course questions the way we see ourselves and how that affects our energy. How you "show up" in life has a direct impact on who you think you are. With NLP and EMP you can change all that to show up being the best version of you. When you want to be a success, and have both personal and professional satisfaction, then the Mindset Life Coaching course is both realistic and transformational”
“I really enjoyed Louise coaching course she touches on key points. For us as coaches and leaders to implement the information into our own coaching business and career. I wanted to take to say thank you for allowing this amazing course to be available and thank you for being present and look forward to connecting more. Thank you again with love and gratitude”
“The course is very informative and the contents are rich with most of the aspects of mindset and improving it, been covered adequately with clarity and good examples. Expert Instructor Louise Anne Maurice has so diligently and with immense dedication conducted the whole course, it's amazing and commendable. A very comprehensive and perfectly designed module and one of the best courses for getting inputs on Mindset Life Coaching. Thanks”
“Louise's approach is just marvelous! I have applied these practices to my own coaching where I coach individuals that want to start their own internet marketing business or haven't been as successful as they wanted to. I see a difference in my clients and really feel like I am making a difference for them. What a wonderful transformation to see! Thank you so much for this!”


Mindset Life Coach Training Real-World Application
Mindset matters! You hear this 2-word phrase used in several ways; to motivate increased productivity in the workplace, to inspire persistence in a struggling entrepreneur or to encourage a new habit for weight-loss. Rarely discussed and most important of all is the type of mindset which truly does matter. In this course, you learn the empowerment mindset framework plus so much more.


Now more than ever companies require their remote teams to have empowered mindsets to complete tasks when no one is watching. Imagine that you’ve been selected to virtually coach an entire department toward a mindset that empowers their team success.
This is the opportunity you have been waiting for but the company wants you to start tomorrow. Are you prepared? Do you have the technology know-how to conduct a remote meeting? Do you have a proven Mindset Group Coaching program with the exact questions and interactive online resources that will AIM this team in the right direction?
What if they want life coaching? What if they want to develop an empowered mindset to achieve their health goals, financial goals, career/business, relationships, personal growth and/or life purpose goals? Are you ready for this request? Do you have step-by-step session guides in these 6 life areas with the right coaching questions, interactive activities and coaching techniques to EMPOWER people?


Empowered Mindset Life Coach Training Opens Doors to Golden Opportunities
Opportunities like this can change your life! As Curriculum Developer and Lead Instructor for Empowerment Coach Academy, I designed Mindset Life Coach Certification Training to give you everything you need to confidently life coach people to cultivate an empowered mindset starting today.
Whether you want to coach yourself, coach other people face-to-face or use technology to coach individuals, groups of people or corporate teams, you are guided step-by-step to master it all.


Build your confidence, even if you have never coached before, through Level 1 life coach video training, hands-on coaching practicums and my step-by-step guidance.

Learn empowered emotional freedom EFT techniques and receive Mindset resources that I developed to use for yourself or with your clients.
Accelerate your Mindset Life Coach Career, Practice or Business with free but optional Level 2 coaching practicums and Certified Empowered Mindset Life Coach Directory.


Life Coach Training Specializing in Empowerment Mindset for the New Normal


Dr. Carol Dweck’s research with students lead to the terms Fixed and Growth Mindset. The research was focused on students’ attitudes about failure. Many have used the findings, which were compiled over 30 years ago, to discuss advancements in brain research called neurogenesis. However, what is typically missing is the HOW. How does the brain change easily and what techniques will support this change?


In this course, I personally train you to use my proprietary Empowerment Coaching Models so that you understand the how but also the underlying why. Why does the brain resist change? Armed with this important insight, you can empower yourself and/or clients to learn the necessary skills to develop a resilient mindset that propels past blocks and obstacles.

With 9+ hours of video tutorials, 160+ downloadable resources ready to use, hands-on practice assignments, interactive learning and Q & A, this continually updated 2-Level Certification Course keeps you in-the-know. Let's break it down for you:

courses.description:
Public Speaking is not something most engineers are naturally good at, but it can be a learned skill. Imagine delivering a speech to a group of engineers and non-engineers alike, and everyone is following you closely and understanding your message. Wouldn't it be nice to know that you can deliver a presentation on an engineering topic and come across as confident, authoritative and understandable to everyone in the audience, even people outside the engineering profession?
In this Public Speaking for Engineering course, you will learn the following:
* How to make complex engineering subjects understandable and memorable
* How to avoid the most common public speaking blunders made by engineers
* How to use PowerPoint effectively
* How to speak to non-engineering audiences
*How to be confident and commanding at all aspects of Public Speaking
This Public Speaking course is delivered primarily through spoken lectures. Because the skill you are learning is speaking related, it only makes sense that you learn through speaking.
The Public Speaking skill you will learn in this class is not primarily theoretical or academic. It is a skill that requires physical habits. That is why you will be asked to take part in numerous exercises where you record yourself speaking on video, and then watching yourself. Learning presentation skills is like learning how to ride a bicycle. You simply have to do it numerous times and work past the wobbling and falling off parts until you get it right.
This Public Speaking course contains numerous video lectures plus several bonus books for your training library.
TJ Walker has been coaching and training people on their Public Speaking skills for 30 years. Now, through the power of Udemy's online platform, he is able to give you the same high quality training that he gives in person to CEOs, Fortune 500 executives, and Presidents of countries. Only you can now receive the training at a tiny fraction of the normal fee for in-person training.
How long this Public Speaking course takes is up to you. The longest part of the course involves you speaking on video, critiquing yourself, and doing it over until you like it. But if you get to the point where you love how you look and sound when you present it will be well worth the time spent. And having this skill will save you time for all future presentations in your life.
You can begin improving your Public Speaking skills right now. You may have an opportunity to speak out as soon as tomorrow, so why waste another day worried that your presentation skills are not up to high standards. Please enroll today.
"5 Stars! Amazing course! It's practical and ready for real-life usage. Just do all these things - and you will be a much better presenter. We're engineers, and our presentations can (and should!) be as great as we are!" Udemy student Денис Шевченко
"5 Stars! It basically seeks to improve the communicative aspect during the presentation and smoothly conveying the technicalities to the mind of the audience." Udemy student Bryan
"5 Stars! I just learned how important to share your presentation with a few of your colleagues before presenting to the senior management as an engineer." Udemy student Sibonelo
There is a 100% Money-Back Guarantee for this course. And the instructor also provides an enhanced guarantee.

What others say about TJ Walker:

“TJ Walker's single-minded devotion to presentation has made him the #1 expert for executives seeking guidance on speaking to the public and media." Bob Bowdon, Anchor/Reporter, Bloomberg Television
“TJ Walker is the leading media trainer in the world." Stu Miller, Viacom News Producer
(TJ Walker's Media Training Worldwide) “The world's leading presentation and media training firm." Gregg Jarrett, Fox News Channel Anchor
This course will also help engineers who are looking to improve in the following areas: sales management, selling with stories, remote selling, delivering bad news to customers, communicating to drive change, appearing to be a purpose driven leader and building a business case.
This Public Speaking course is ideal for anyone searching for more info on the following: public speaking - presentation - speaking -  first steps into public speaking - debate - first step into public speaking - speech. courses.title: The Complete Course on Piping Components for Oil&Gas Career
courses.bio: Learn about Pipe,Fittings,Olets,Gaskets, Flanges,Bolting materials,Valve,orifice flanges,Spectacle Blind,steam traps etc
objectives: Differentiate between codes, standards, and specifications to ensure piping systems meet legal, safety, and project-specific requirements.
Identify and classify all major piping components, including pipes, fittings, flanges, gaskets, and over 18 types of valves, based on their design, function.
Select appropriate piping materials (such as Carbon Steel, Alloy Steel, Stainless Steel, and non-metallics) by evaluating critical process conditions.
Interpret and decode standard markings and material designations (e.g., ASTM A106 Gr B) on any piping component for accurate identification and procurement.
Explain the manufacturing processes for pipes (seamless vs. welded), fittings, and flanges, and understand the importance of heat treatments and quality checks.
Recognize different types of pipe supports, restraints, and anchors, and understand their role in safely managing pipe loads and thermal movements.
Describe the key quality assurance tests, including Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) and Destructive Testing (DT), used to verify the integrity and reliability.

Course Road Map: Know the things that you will learn in this course.
Watch Before You Start the Course!
The Language of Piping: Learning Codes,: Section Intro: Why Codes, Standards & Specs are Crucial
Decoding Standards: Your "How-To" for Design & Manufacturing
Understanding Codes: When Guidelines Become Law
Code vs. Standard vs. Specification: Know the Key Differences
Grouping Codes & Standards: A Practical Categorization
Deep Dive: System Design Codes & Standards Explained
The "Why": Importance of Codes & Standards in Piping Safety & Efficiency
List of Code & Standards used in Process Piping
Building Your Foundation: Process Piping: Assembling a Process Plant: A Step-by-Step Introduction to Piping Components
The Core Components: Pipes, Fittings, Fl: Pipes Uncovered: Types, Construction (Seamless/Welded) & End Finishes
Pipe Sizing Demystified: NPS, DN, NB & Bore Classifications
Understanding Pipe Schedules & Wall Thickness (Incl. Stainless Steel 'S' Sch.)
Pipe Length Explained: Single Random (SRL) vs. Double Random (DRL)
Pipe vs. Tube: Mastering the Critical Differences & Applications
Introduction to Pipe Fittings: Changing Direction & Size
Essential Bends: Elbows (LR/SR), Reducing Elbows, Miter Bends & Returns
Branching & Sizing: Tees, Crosses, Reducers (Concentric/Eccentric), Caps & Stub
Small Bore Connections: Unions, Couplings (Full/Half) & Swages
Flange Fundamentals: Classification by Connection & Facing Type
Flange Faces In-Depth: FF, RF, RTJ, Male-Female & Tongue-Groove
The Seal is in the Surface: Flange Face Serration (Spiral/Concentric, RMS/AARH)
Flange Ratings: Understanding Flange Class (Pressure-Temp) & Flange Schedule
Common Flange Types Pt 1: Threaded, Socket-Weld & Slip-On Explored
Common Flange Types Pt 2: Lap Joint, Weld Neck & Blind Flanges Explored
Branch Connections: Traditional (Reinforcement Pad) vs. Olets (Self-Reinforced)
Meet the Olets Pt 1: Weldolet, Sockolet & Thredolet Explained
Meet the Olets Pt 2: Elbolet, Nipolet, Latrolet & Coupolet
Gaskets: What They Are, Why They're Used & Types (Non-Metallic, Metallic, Compo)
Soft Seals: Deep Dive into Non-Metallic Gaskets (CNAF, PTFE, Rubber)
Robust Sealing: Deep Dive into Metallic Gaskets (RTJ - R, RX, BX Types)
Best of Both: Composite Gaskets (Spiral Wound, Metal Jacketed, Kammprofile)
The Workhorse Gasket: Spiral Wound Gaskets In-Depth (Components & Sealing)
Heat Exchanger Seals: Understanding Metal Jacketed Gaskets
High-Performance Sealing: Kammprofile (Camprofile) Gaskets
Holding Together: Understanding Bolting Materials (Studs, Bolts, Nuts, Washers)
Controlling the Flow: Guide to Piping Va: On/Off Hero: Understanding Gate Valves (Types & Applications)
Precision Control: Understanding Globe Valves (Design & Throttling)
Quick Action, Tight Shutoff: Understanding Plug Valves (Ports & Designs)
Versatile & Reliable: Understanding Ball Valves (Designs & Operation)
Compact Control: Understanding Butterfly Valves (Types & Applications)

requirements: If you work in Oil & Gas, Refinery, Petrochemical, or Power Plant industries and handle piping systems, you're already qualified — that’s the only requirement.

courses.description:
5 Hours additional videos added.
Updated in Aug 2025 to incorporate feedback received on the previous version along with lots of new content.
Unlock the essential knowledge of process piping components and significantly boost your expertise and career in the Oil & Gas, Petrochemical, Power Generation, or any related process industry! This comprehensive and meticulously structured course is your A-Z guide, designed to take you from foundational concepts to a deep, practical understanding of every critical aspect of piping components.
This course is engineered to equip you with immediately applicable knowledge, whether you are just starting your career, looking to transition into the piping field, or are a seasoned professional aiming to refresh and expand your understanding. You will learn not just the "what," but the "why" and "how" behind piping components, their selection, manufacturing, and quality assurance.
What you'll learn in this comprehensive course:
Learn the Language of Piping: Gain a rock-solid understanding of Codes, Standards (ASME, ASTM, API, ISO, etc.), and Specifications. Learn their definitions, key differences, and how they are applied to ensure safety, efficiency, and consistency in piping systems.
Become an Expert on Piping Components:
Pipes: Explore types (seamless vs. welded), manufacturing methods, end types (plain, beveled, threaded), pipe size identification (NPS, DN, NB), and pipe schedule numbers.
Pipe Fittings: Deep dive into elbows (45°/90°, Long/Short Radius), reducing elbows, miter bends, returns, tees (equal/reducing), crosses, reducers (concentric/eccentric), caps, stub ends, couplings, unions, and swage nipples. Understand wrought vs. forged fittings and key dimensional standards (ASME B16.9, B16.28, B16.11).
Flanges: Classify flanges by connection type (Threaded, Socket-Welded, Slip-On, Lap Joint, Weld Neck, Blind) and facing type (Flat Face, Raised Face, RTJ, Male & Female, Tongue & Groove). Understand flange face serration, flange class, and flange schedule.
Olets: Learn about Weldolet, Sockolet, Thredolet, Elbolet, Nipolet, Latrolet, and Coupolet branch connections.
Gaskets: Understand Non-Metallic (CNAF, PTFE, Rubber), Metallic (RTJ - R, RX, BX types), and Composite gaskets (Spiral Wound, Metal Jacketed, Camprofile). Learn selection criteria and spiral wound gasket markings/color codes.
Bolting Materials: Cover studs, bolts, nuts, and washers, including common ASTM grades (e.g., A193 B7, A194 2H) and coatings.
Valve Knowledge: Understand the types, functions, and applications of essential Piping Valves like Gate, Globe, Plug, Ball, Butterfly, Needle, Check, Pinch, and Safety Valves.
Specialized Components: Explore Special Piping Components including Long Neck Flanges, Orifice Flanges, Spectacle Blinds, Strainers, Expansion Joints, Steam Traps, Scrapper Tees, and Flange Isolation Kits.
Material Science: Gain in-depth knowledge of Piping Material selection criteria. Understand "Killed Steel." Explore Ferrous Metals (Carbon, Alloy, Stainless Steels - Austenitic, Ferritic, Martensitic, PH, Duplex), Non-Ferrous Metals (Copper, Nickel, Aluminum, Titanium, Zirconium alloys), and Non-Metals (PVC, HDPE, GRE/GRP). Learn about Lined, Clad, and Coated Pipes. Identify common ASTM/ASME material grades for pipes, fittings, flanges, and bolting.
Manufacturing Processes: Discover how various piping components are Manufactured, including Seamless Pipes (Mandrel Mill, Plug Mill, Extrusion, Forging) and Welded Pipes (ERW, EFW, HFW, SAW). Understand manufacturing for Elbows, Tees, Reducers, Caps, Stub Ends, Forged Fittings, Flanges, Olets, Gaskets, and Bolting.
Heat Treatment Explained: Learn the requirements and common methods of Heat Treatment (Normalizing, Quenching, Tempering, Annealing, Solution Annealing).
Quality Assurance: Understand vital Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) methods (MPT, ET, UT, RT, PT, PMI, Hardness Testing) and Destructive Testing (DT) (Tensile, Bend, Flattening, Impact, Creep tests). Learn about Metallurgical Testing, Hydro Testing, Proof Testing, and essential Visual and Dimensional Inspection techniques.
Decoding Component Markings: Confidently interpret the Marking Requirements for all major piping components to ensure correct identification and traceability.
Course Structure Overview:
This course is logically structured into multiple sections, ensuring a progressive and easy-to-follow learning experience:
Course Overview & Introduction
Understanding Codes, Standards, and Specifications
Process Piping Fundamentals (Illustrated with a Dummy Plant Example)
In-Depth: Piping Components (Pipes, Fittings, Flanges, Olets, Gaskets, Bolting)
All About Piping Valves
Exploring Special Piping Components
Piping Materials Science and Selection
Common ASTM & ASME Materials for Pipe Components
Manufacturing Processes for Piping Components
Heat Treatment of Piping Components
Non-Destructive and Destructive Testing Methods
Visual and Dimensional Inspection of Piping Components
Standard Marking of Piping Components
About Your Instructor:
Varun Patel is a dedicated Mechanical Engineer and a certified Project Management Professional (PMP) with extensive hands-on experience in the process piping field. He has a passion for teaching and has designed this course to transfer his practical knowledge in an efficient, clear, and impactful way, enabling you to achieve your professional development goals.
Ready to Master a Process Piping?
This course is more than just lectures; it’s a comprehensive learning experience designed to equip you with the practical knowledge and confidence needed to excel. Stop feeling overwhelmed by piping complexities and start mastering them today!
Enroll now and take a significant step towards advancing your career in the process industry!

requirements: No prior experience is necessary for this course. It is open to individuals involved in aviation, including airline staff, aviation professionals, those in aerospace, and UAV operators.
courses.description:
Humans design, build, operate and maintain the aviation system. It is no wonder that the majority of aviation accidents and incidents have roots in human factors. With this realization comes the conclusion that quality human factors training is effective in improving safety. This course presents human factors information in a manner that can be readily understood and applied by aviation practitioners. Emphasis is placed on identifying the causes of human error, predicting how human error can affect performance, and applying countermeasures to reduce or eliminate its effects.
Training Operational Personnel in Human Factors. The emphasis is from the pilot’s perspective, but is applicable to all phases of aviation operations. The course relies heavily on participation, case studies, demonstrations, self-assessment and practical exercises.
Objectives: To provide class participants with human factors knowledge and practical tools that can be readily applied to improve safety within their respective organizations.
Who Should Attend: This course has been carefully designed to appeal to a wide-spectrum of professionals actively involved in aircraft operations. There is a special emphasis for safety managers, training, flight department and maintenance managers and supervisors, pilots, air traffic controllers, dispatchers, and schedulers, aircraft maintenance technicisan, base maintenace and other.

Overview of Human Factors and Recent Advances
Human Error
Systems Approach to Aviation Safety Improvements
Cases of Aircraft Accidents Due to Human Error
Introduction to Human Error Accident Reduction Training
Reason Model

Human Factors in Automation

Threat and Error Management
Fatigue and Alertness Management
Communications
Workload Management
Monitoring and Cross-checking
Decision Making
Leadership/Followership
Information Processing
Managing Stress

Case Studies
target_audience: This Human Factors course is designed for all aviation personnel—pilots, air traffic controllers, maintenance technicians, airport staff, and airline employees. Learn how human performance, limitations, and decision-making impact safety and operations in aviation. Ideal for professionals in aerospace, airports, and airlines seeking to enhance safety and efficiency.
